channel.title: Stick World
channel.description:
I think this is the correct section.
[center][b]Stick World[/b][/center]
"Stick World" is a creation in the making. (Although I thought of the idea years ago, but it is so simple anyone could come up with it) An mmorpg that is based on "sticks". A Stick Figure (the players character) and a world of sticks to adventure!
Why Sticks? Simplicity. Some of the best games are based on simplicity. Also I am not an artist :P
[center]Perspective[/center]
The idea is to have the game be 2d with a 3d influence. All sprites will be 2d but the in game look will feel 3d I took a picture of a rsc dragon and made it "stick" to show you you an idea of what you can do with sticks. A black and white based game would kill the eyes after a while so objects, npcs, buildings will have shadows of grey.
[center][URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/706/unled1wez.jpg/][IMG]http://img706.imageshack.us/img706/2649/unled1wez.jpg[/img][/URL][/center]
Below is a picture of the client layout (pretty basic) just to give you an idea of what is inside my head.
[center][URL=http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/703/unled2kn.jpg/][IMG]http://img703.imageshack.us/img703/435/unled2kn.jpg[/img][/URL] [/center]
[center]Landscape[/center] I was thinking of just having the world be the earth but is just too large. Then I thought of having the world be a mini Pangaea. Which I am pretty certain will stay. Maybe add a few islands to it.
[center][img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cb/Pangaea_continents.svg/220px-Pangaea_continents.svg.png[/img][/center]
[center]Timeline/Storyline[/center]
I personally like mid evil based games. So I have a pretty confident this will be based on the old days when maces were around. The storyline will be completely from scratch. I enjoy quests and adventures and I feel it is a crucial aspect of any game. A storyline allows for a developer to communicate to its players and show the players the world that is in their mind. A storyline will be written properly and from scratch.
[center]PVP[/center] At this point I am lost. I think games that are based on clicks suck (minecraft for example) latency was so unfair. I also don't want to straight up copy runescapes pvp design. Hmm

item.title: Stick World
item.dc:creator: @Racist_Turtle Racist Turtle
item.description:
@Racist_Turtle wrote:

I love the idea. I love the simplicity that comes with games like these, even with that, they are extremely entertaining/addicting.

Read full topic

item.title: Stick World
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

I think a stick figure fighter would be sick imo. Might make both

Read full topic

item.title: Stick World
item.dc:creator: @Erj Erj
item.description:
@Erj wrote:

Yeah I know right lol. When I hear “Stick” I think of all those cool animations.

Dungeon Fighter Online seems to be getting the mechanics right. They’re doing pretty good I think. It all boils down to replay-ability. You got to give players something, so they always come back for more. Whether it’s items, stats, achievements, gamemodes, etc. you just gotta capture their attention for all you can.

As far as my opinions go, I think it has potential to be something cool. Beat 'em ups are usually fun for one play-through. Then it goes into the back of the line for quite a while. I loved Final Fight as a kid, and played it a lot on my SNES (All 4 versions to be exact), but usually after a playthrough I called it quits for a week.

But meh, I’m digressing here. I haven’t really thought of having a stick game. But since they’re just stick figures, I guess the possibilities are endless.

Read full topic

item.title: Stick World
item.dc:creator: @IlikeArrays IlikeArrays
item.description:
@IlikeArrays wrote:

^lol. When I was younger I always liked the videos people made of the stick fighting. Xiao Xiao 3 being my favorite one.
http://www.stickpage.com/xiao3play.shtml

I like your idea though but will it go far?

Read full topic

item.title: Stick World
item.dc:creator: @Erj Erj
item.description:
@Erj wrote:

This seems like a good idea. But was far from what I was expecting. Was kinda expecting an open world game (or something like that) where you go around doing epic Kung-Fu, Samurai, Anime fighting thingy.

Read full topic
